alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 8:57PM EDT until March 20 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 116.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EDT Friday was 116.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 116.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM EDT.
